page.title: 15The Bertie Arms
page.content: This stone built and thatch roofed Public House was built in 1640. Its name was given by the family who used to live in Uffington House. It is managed by Mr John Bailey- he and his wife work long hours to provide excellent service. 7 other people are also employed here. Around 4 barrels of beer (each 54 gallons) are consumed each week. Home made meals are provided- steak and mushroom pie being the most popular. About 100 younger and 60 older regulars drink there, but passing traffic provides most of the trade. Recently the pop group "The Grumbleweeds" called in for a meal. During renovations in 1969 60 gold coins were found under the front door. The roof was re-thached in 1984 at a cost of Â£10,000 and it is expected to last 30 years.
